title: [Neuroscience] The prevalence of cannabis use in pregnancy is increasing, especially during the first trimester to mitigate common symptoms like morning sickness. Prenatal delta-9-tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) exposure is associated with changes in rhesus macaque DNA methylation enriched for autism genes.

[Cancer] Eliminating extra chromosomes in cancer cells prevent tumor growth. Cancer cells with extra chromosomes depend on those chromosomes for tumor growth, and eliminating them prevents the cells from forming tumors. Selectively targeting extra chromosomes may offer a new route for treating cancer.
